20110104231523.000|20110104231526.000|TR0|
20110104231526.000|20110104231528.000|TR0|JACK CAFFERTY, CNN ANCHOR:  As things in 
20110104231528.000|20110104231530.000|TR0|Washington continue to go from bad to 
20110104231530.000|20110104231532.000|TR0|worse, in my humble opinion, here's an 
20110104231532.000|20110104231534.000|TR0|idea that could really shake up the way 
20110104231534.000|20110104231537.000|TR0|politics is done in this country.  How 
20110104231537.000|20110104231539.000|TR0|about we let the children vote?
20110104231539.000|20110104231541.000|TR0|
20110104231541.000|20110104231543.000|TR0|And it might not be as crazy an idea as it 
20110104231543.000|20110104231546.000|TR0|sounds at first.
20110104231546.000|20110104231548.000|TR0|
20110104231548.000|20110104231550.000|TR0|Politico.com has got a piece about a 
20110104231550.000|20110104231552.000|TR0|recent report in "The Economist" on the 
20110104231552.000|20110104231554.000|TR0|problem of the aging population in Japan.
20110104231554.000|20110104231557.000|TR0|
20110104231557.000|20110104231559.000|TR0|The median age of the voting population in 
20110104231559.000|20110104231601.000|TR0|Japan will soon be 65, which gives older 
20110104231601.000|20110104231603.000|TR0|voters a huge amount of political power 
20110104231603.000|20110104231606.000|TR0|and means that it's highly unlikely they 
20110104231606.000|20110104231608.000|TR0|will ever support cuts in entitlement 
20110104231608.000|20110104231610.000|TR0|programs.  Sound familiar?
20110104231610.000|20110104231612.000|TR0|
20110104231612.000|20110104231614.000|TR0|The United States facing similar problems. 
20110104231614.000|20110104231617.000|TR0| As the baby boomers age, entitlement 
20110104231617.000|20110104231619.000|TR0|spending is taking up a larger and larger 
20110104231619.000|20110104231621.000|TR0|portion of our budget and thus growing our 
20110104231621.000|20110104231623.000|TR0|deficit exponentially.
20110104231623.000|20110104231626.000|TR0|
20110104231626.000|20110104231628.000|TR0|Well, one expert who wrote into "The 
20110104231628.000|20110104231630.000|TR0|Economist" suggests an answer to this 
20110104231630.000|20110104231632.000|TR0|dilemma is to let kids vote.  In practical 
20110104231632.000|20110104231634.000|TR0|terms, it would mean giving parents an 
20110104231634.000|20110104231637.000|TR0|extra vote for every child.      This 
20110104231637.000|20110104231639.000|TR0|would take away some of the voting power 
20110104231639.000|20110104231641.000|TR0|from seniors in the U.S., who 
20110104231641.000|20110104231643.000|TR0|traditionally vote in large numbers at 
20110104231643.000|20110104231646.000|TR0|election time.  And it would give the 
20110104231646.000|20110104231648.000|TR0|future generation, which after all is 
20110104231648.000|20110104231650.000|TR0|going to have to pay off this massive 
20110104231650.000|20110104231652.000|TR0|debt, a say in the decisions that are 
20110104231652.000|20110104231654.000|TR0|being made today.
20110104231654.000|20110104231657.000|TR0|
20110104231657.000|20110104231659.000|TR0|However, it would also put the 
20110104231659.000|20110104231701.000|TR0|responsibility on parents to use those 
20110104231701.000|20110104231703.000|TR0|votes in the best interest of their 
20110104231703.000|20110104231705.000|TR0|children.  That's a tall order, too.

20110104231928.000|20110104231930.000|TR0|
20110104231930.000|20110104231932.000|TR0|LAWRENCE (voice-over):  He never saw it 
20110104231932.000|20110104231934.000|TR0|coming, the governor of Pakistan's most 
20110104231934.000|20110104231936.000|TR0|populated province gunned down by one of 
20110104231936.000|20110104231939.000|TR0|his elite security guards.
20110104231939.000|20110104231941.000|TR0|
20110104231941.000|20110104231943.000|TR0|Salman Taseer walked out of an Islamabad 
20110104231943.000|20110104231945.000|TR0|grocery store and the guard shot him 26 
20110104231945.000|20110104231948.000|TR0|times.  The governor died instantly.  And 
20110104231948.000|20110104231950.000|TR0|the guard just gave himself up.
20110104231950.000|20110104231952.000|TR0|
20110104231952.000|20110104231954.000|TR0|So, why Taseer?  It all comes back to 
20110104231954.000|20110104231956.000|TR0|Pakistan's blasphemy law, which makes it a 
20110104231956.000|20110104231959.000|TR0|crime to insult Islam, a crime punishable 
20110104231959.000|20110104232001.000|TR0|by death.
20110104232001.000|20110104232003.000|TR0|
20110104232003.000|20110104232005.000|TR0|SALMAN TASEER, GOVERNOR OF PUNJAB, 
20110104232005.000|20110104232008.000|TR0|PAKISTAN:  The blasphemy law is not a 
20110104232008.000|20110104232010.000|TR0|God-made law.
20110104232010.000|20110104232012.000|TR0|
20110104232012.000|20110104232014.000|TR0|LAWRENCE:  On CNN and elsewhere, the 
20110104232014.000|20110104232016.000|TR0|governor of Punjab Province public 
20110104232016.000|20110104232019.000|TR0|condemned it.
20110104232019.000|20110104232021.000|TR0|
20110104232021.000|20110104232023.000|TR0|TASEER:  It is a law which gives an excuse 
20110104232023.000|20110104232025.000|TR0|to extremists and reactionaries to target 
20110104232025.000|20110104232028.000|TR0|weak people and minorities.
20110104232028.000|20110104232030.000|TR0|

20110104234037.000|20110104234040.000|TR0|culturally, the Navy still operates on two 
20110104234040.000|20110104234042.000|TR0|levels.
20110104234042.000|20110104234044.000|TR0|

20110104234950.000|20110104234952.000|TR0|1862. This year it happens to fall on

20110104235106.000|20110104235108.000|TR0|dropping the voting age to, say, 16.  It 
20110104235108.000|20110104235110.000|TR0|could be the added benefit letting the 
20110104235110.000|20110104235112.000|TR0|kids vote at school during school hours.  
20110104235112.000|20110104235115.000|TR0|We could increase the number of people 
20110104235115.000|20110104235117.000|TR0|actually voting.  I like the logic of them 
20110104235117.000|20110104235119.000|TR0|being able to vote on matters concerning 
20110104235119.000|20110104235121.000|TR0|the debt, since they're the ones who are 
20110104235121.000|20110104235123.000|TR0|going to get stuck with it."
20110104235123.000|20110104235126.000|TR0|
20110104235126.000|20110104235128.000|TR0|Nick writes: "Not a bad idea, but the 
20110104235128.000|20110104235130.000|TR0|potential for abuse, voter fraud, et 
20110104235130.000|20110104235132.000|TR0|cetera, seems astronomical.  I think it's 
20110104235132.000|20110104235135.000|TR0|misleading to say let kids vote.  It 
20110104235135.000|20110104235137.000|TR0|should be give parents an extra vote for 
20110104235137.000|20110104235139.000|TR0|each child they have.  I can't imagine the

20110104235143.000|20110104235146.000|TR0|shot."
